intro: Trichoscypha barbata, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Trichoscypha barbata plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
